title: Jacob Bernoulli and the Law of Large Numbers
description: A 60-second lesson on Jacob Bernoulli and the Law of Large Numbers.

hook.text: Flip a coin 10 times and you might get 7 heads. Flip it 10,000 times and you'll get very close to 50%.

buildup.text: Jacob Bernoulli proved this mathematically in 1713 â€” more trials mean results converge to the true probability.

discovery.text: The Law of Large Numbers is why casinos always profit. Individual bets are random; millions aren't.

twist.text: Bernoulli spent 20 years proving this theorem. He died before his masterwork was published.

climax.text: This law is the foundation of polling, insurance, quality control, and every statistical estimate.

punchline.text: Randomness obeys rules â€” if you wait long enough.
